about_page_about_section_desc1: Open Genes collects data for human genes associated with aging, such as: gene functions, associations of allelic variants of genes with longevity and age-related phenotype, processes, diseases the gene products are involved in, and etc. But foremost, it provides carefully structured data of lifespan experiments collected manually from publications.
about_page_about_section_desc2: We provide approximately up to 40 parameters for each individual manipulation, depending on the method and data availability. Combining these parameters allows researchers to assess the quality of the experiment and better understand its results.
about_page_about_section_title: Open Genes provides structured data of lifespan experiments collected manually from publications. We provide approximately up to 40 parameters for each individual manipulation, depending on the method and data availability.
footer_about: Open Genes  is a biological database of human genes associated with aging and lifespan, maintained by
about_page_curated_section_subtitle: Biologists manually collect information about the gene evolution, its functions, and methods for determining the gene's association with aging and longevity.
about_page_donation_text:
Make a donation and support the project.
 Even small amount matters.
about_page_features_1_desc:
We have collected data on human genes associated with aging and on which processes
 their products are involved.
about_page_features_2_desc: Compare genes by function, expression, evolutionary age, see correlations with other genes.
about_page_features_3_desc: Work with all collected data using the web interface and API. Use it in your apps.
about_page_participation_text:
Join Open Genes developers team 
on GitHub. We have many different tasks for you.
about_page_question_link: Criteria for selecting genes for the database
about_page_subtitle:
We give researchers in the field of aging genetics and related
 processes an ability to build hypotheses using proven data,
 and provide the necessary tools.
about_page_title: Open data on genes associated with aging
about_page_why_section_1: Complete structured information about changes in genes that extend lifespan in mammals
about_page_why_section_3: Exhaustive information on age-related population-average changes in gene expression in tissues in humans and animals
about_page_why_section_5: A list of all genes and their main characteristics put together
about_page_why_section_6: Ability to group and compare genes according to various criteria and their combinations
about_page_why_section_title: What is missing in the existing genetic databases

expression_change_hint_text:
This filter does not reflect the results of a meta-analysis and is not based on results
 with untested statistical significance. These are summarized findings drawn from the studies described for each gene.
experiments_page_download_description: All studies are available for download as individual datasets
datasets_page_description:
These are datasets with additional data that may be of interest for studying genes associated with aging.
 However, not all genes from these datasets are associated with aging.
gene_page_error_no_article_yet: An article for this gene is not ready yet.

gene_page_chromosome_location_paragraph: {{symbol}} is {{length}}kb long. It is located on {{arm}} of {{chromosome}}th chromosome.
gene_page_chromosome_length_paragraph1: {{symbol}} is {{length}}kb long. Genes are divided into groups by length: short, mid-length, and long.
gene_page_chromosome_length_paragraph2: The length of short, mid-length, and long genes are <15kb, 15kb–100kb, and >100kb, respectively.
go_results_start_description: Type in your query and press Enter or tap 🔍
go_results_start_title: Search for genes by Gene Ontology annotations description
help_page_title: Open Genes articles, questions and guidelines
hint_api_docs_description: How to get data from Open Genes API
horvath_clock_page_description: Horvath Clock is a multi-tissue predictor of age that allows one to estimate the DNA methylation age of most tissues and cell types
link_hpa: This gene on Human Protein Atlas
main_page_header_description:
Structured data on human genes associated with aging:
functions, evolution, the influence of gene activity on lifespan, age-related changes in gene expression, associations of allelic variants of genes with longevity and age-related phenotype.
main_page_hint_table_settings: The gene list is now customizable. You can remove and add columns in the data table, just tap on "Filters" button.
news_page_articles_title: Articles and news by Open Longevity
news_page_no_wp_articles: An error occurred and articles were not loaded
news_page_no_news: An error occurred and news feed was not loaded.
research_data_purple_form_line_hint: Please note that this column indicates the genetic background. If additional copies of the gene were introduced into the genome to achieve overexpression, then the line that carries the same drivers as the experimental line is used as a control line. They are listed in the promoters/drivers column. If an inducible mutation was used, then the control group also carries this mutation, while an inducer was used in the experimental group, but not in the control group. This should be taken into account when analyzing the lifespan of controls, as additional genetic constructs may themselves affect lifespan.
research_data_purple_form_result_hint: The result is shown for average or median lifespan.
research_data_l_title_sample_data: Details about the sample and containment conditions
research_data_l_cohort_size:
Size of 
control and experiment groups
research_data_l_density: Quantity of animals in a container
research_data_l_therapy_hint: Description of the therapy course for drug therapy and inducible mutations.
research_data_l_therapy_mutation_inducti: The mutation was induced by drug withdrawal
research_data_n_of_control_and_experimen: N of control and experiment groups
research_data_associated_and_non_associa: Associated and non-associated alleles frequency in control and experiment groups, %
